website_summaries.verdict: Those looking for an induction-ready stock pot with the benefits of stainless steel and aluminum should be satisfied.
pros: Available in a variety of sizes
100-quart capacity is ideal for restaurant or soup kitchen use
cons: Stated sizes may not match actual capacities
Some quality control issues reported on arrival

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pot easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I just LOVE this pot! The design is perfectly smooth stainless inside and out that is extremely easy to clean (NOTE: You need a big sink!) We use it to cook our quince for making quince spread and have found the thick heavy bottom to ensure even heat that prevents burning when the temperature is carefully controlled on our induction cooktop burner, even over extended cooking times. As our production goes up, we will definitely consider purchasing a second pot. Oh, by the way, it also made a fabulous turkey soup, easily holding the bones from a 28 pound turkey!
customer_reviews.author: ChileKid

customer_reviews.title: Totally unacceptable!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was deliverd on time. Finally I can cook some soup!! However when we received it, box had been taped over many times indicating item was returned many times already. (You can see from the picture) When we placed the cover, it doesn't fit. There is a dent in the pot and the cover is warped. This item lacks quality control and totally unacceptable. Returning this item and not recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Angelito Paulme Jr

customer_reviews.title: Totally False Advertising NOT 20 Quarts
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised Amazon allows this to be advertised as a 20 quart pot. I carefully measured 16 quarts and it filled it up completely. Also, the one I received had been returned at least once if not 2 or 3 times. How many returns of this item do you need before you realise that lies DO NOT sell merchandise???
customer_reviews.author: PJClark

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stock pot. We finally have a stock pot that takes up the entire width of the 11" element on our Electrolux Induction Range!! So many of them are quite a bit narrower but taller. I like the proportions of this one much better. The handles and lid are very nice and there's a good weight to the pot, but not too heavy. The finish is very nice. Note, the weight listed on Amazon is way off. I measured it at 6.5 pounds, not 7.9 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: aaroncgiTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: SUPER SOUPER
customer_reviews.text: In winter my husband and I make soup. We share it with his mom and dad. Our burners are small and we can get only two pots on at a time. We decided to purchase an induction cooker to help and needed a stainless steel pot. Since our 4 pots of soup were made and frozen we decided to fill this pot with spaghetti sauce. WE LOVE THIS POT. Heats quickly on the cooker and did a wonderful job with the sauce. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Ina Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE POT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this exact same pot about 5 years ago. We live in Louisiana and often make gumbos, soups and stews. You need a pot with a thick heavy bottom that doesn't burn your food and can handle all of the cooking we do. I have purchased several of these pots as gifts and the most recent was a Christmas gift for my brother and his wife. They have used the pot several times since Christmas and love theirs as much as I love mine! Highly recommend! Great large stock pot!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Romero

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pot. Had pin holes in it. Sent a replacement. That one Also had holes in the bottom of it. My wife made a mistake and asked for replacement not rerund. Got the 3rd pot delivers with a bubble in the inside of the pot. No Quality Control or just no quality from manufacture. All I wanted to do was make large batches of chicken soup to give out. What a shame
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKee

customer_reviews.title: thick manufacturer coating and dents
customer_reviews.text: came with a thicker then usual coating of that grey stuff you usually have to wash away from china steel. took an hour to get rid of all of it. had a small dent on the bottom, dint seem too much of a big deal. and finally of course its one of those "triple-ply" bottoms that just squeal on induction cooktops and reduce performance drastically. but thats expected in this day and age. 3 stars overall for the price.
customer_reviews.author: asdfer master

customer_reviews.title: Great for Home Brewing 5 Gallon Extract Kit Beer
customer_reviews.text: I use this for malt extract home brewing. The 5 gallon size is perfect for recipes calling for 2.5 gallons of water. Plenty of room is left for adding malt extract, hops, sugars, etc. without it coming too close to the top to worry about boil over. The base of the pot is heavily weighted and distributes heat evenly. It has an overall sturdiness and heavy-duty feel. I've used it for three batches thus far. It cleans easily and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jed S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made pot. Haven't encountered discoloration issues others have mentioned. I use for beer, and a quick scrub with PBW has all it has ever needed. It's seems well made an has decent heft to it. I like the tri-clad aluminum sandwich bottom. It helps to evenly distribute heat, and is essentially a built in flame tamer if you're using gas. I've used this on induction and propane burners
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Solid Heavy-Duty Pot
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my lab and its really well-built. Super heavy and well made. Seems to distribute heat really well. As far as cleaning we have an industrial high-heat washer that cleans and sterilizes so there's that. This pot is going to last us a very long time and that says a lot. I learned a long time ago buy quality and you'll get quality. This is quality
customer_reviews.author: XS Labs

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS POT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pot big enough to make my Italian sauce with enough room to hold the meatballs, sausage and the Braciole while they were cooking. This is it! It’s big enough to hold everything but not too big for a residential stove. I kept looking and reading reviews about other pots and found this gem on Amazon and I love it! Got it on sale and took the 15% first time discount plus $10 left on a gift card. What a deal!! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer: JC III

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I was going to cut a 2 inch hole in the lid and weld a copper pipe and sanitary fitting in order to mount a column on it and distill water. When I got the pot, it was so gorgeous that I can't bring myself to cut it. I use it for large batch cooking, and for pasteurizing mason jars of veggies and fruits. It is simply a work of art. It is thick, polished, heavy bottom, and induction ready. Can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Little Pizza

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a LONG time for a good sized decent quality pot. I did a lot of research both on line and in brick and mortar stores. I cannot say that there are not better pot out there, but I LOVE it. I really like to cook LARGE batches of spaghetti sauce and soups and them freeze and can them. This is perfect. I can cook a large batch and still lift the pot. My mother is not as strong and does have struggles lifting it, but she can ladle some out and then lift it. Use this pot regularly and am so pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Manatee

customer_reviews.title: Not great but worth the monehy
customer_reviews.text: We use these in a professional setting. (We have four of them). They aren't great. They are cheaply made and the bottoms are fairly thin. But they work on an induction unit and they serve our purposes well, and they are quite inexpensive. For home use I'd probably go with something a bit more graceful.
customer_reviews.author: pandajama

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stock pot for induction stove tops
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a deal on an induction friendly stock pot and this finally went on sale! What a great deal and a great looking stock pot with sealing lid. High quality craftsmanship. I've used it on a giant pot of Pho and Bo Kho. Yummy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Ninja

customer_reviews.title: great pot, look forward to getting a few more sizes
customer_reviews.text: this is a great pot, I use it to make large batches of jumbalaya.. the pot I used before would often burn the botom and leave a mess to clean up.. I try not to peak at my jumbalaya or stir it for the 20 minutes until I open it to add the shrimp.. this can often lead to sticking.. Not with this pot, it has come out perfect every time.. I look forward to getting a smaller size to cook smaller meals as this one is a bit overkill unless you are cooking for large groups..
customer_reviews.author: Codycleve

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to go with my nuwave cook top. My nuwave takes about 6 minutes till water starts to boil...but at least this has a totally flat bottom which is hard to find. Most cookware has an indention. It also works great on my flat top stove. I think it is great. If you are looking for induction cookware I think this one will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Rock Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love the pot!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent quality stainless steel pot. I have a 64 quart, same brand; I use it to boil a whole sack of peanuts. I needed a smaller one for making gumbo...this 24 quart size is perfect and with the aluminum clad bottom, it's induction ready. I also needed a new water bath canner as my porcelain one finally "sprung a leak"; this pot will accommodate the wire basket for processing the jars in the water bath. This pot will get plenty of use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: This thing is sturdy and has a thick base.  Great heat distribution.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints whatsoever. This thing is pretty too, and after using it to boil several batches of beer wort, still looks new. My wife decided to get rid of our old tramonita 20 quart pot when she realized how nice this pot was, so now we use this thing for giant batches of soup too.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pot, but not sure how long it will last. My other SS pots won’t allow my thermometer’s magnet adhere to the inside edge, but this one does, so I imagine it is because of the high nickel content! Not a downside for my use!
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality stockpot for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. Got tired of waiting forever for my existing stockpots to heat up and cook evenly. Purchased one for myself some time ago and loved it so much, I purchased one for my son-in-law as a Christmas gift. Heavy duty, commercial feeling. Heats up and cooks everything quickly and evenly, even on a glass cook top.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD J. H.

customer_reviews.title: It SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: This pot sucks! It sticks like crazy! I hate that I spent my money on this!
customer_reviews.author: HPeezie

customer_reviews.title: Best stock pot in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stock pot at a great price. Beautifully crafted with a great finish and very convenient handles. Have used for several soups and chilis. Nicely weighed with wonderful great distribution. Really like this pot!
customer_reviews.author: martyoooo

customer_reviews.title: Not real stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: This is not real stainless steel. Show brown rust marks at bottom of the pot and cannot be cleaned after just used it once. Also, it took a long time to boil half pot of water.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mao

customer_reviews.title: Best pot on earth.
customer_reviews.text: I own five of these 20 quart pots. We do a lot of cooking and preserving and homesteading. This is far and away the best quality pot I have ever used. By far the best quality per $. The cheap pots are just thin junk. This is proper stainless and ready to go for induction.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: A lot larger than I imagined!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 20 quart stock pot as I will be making my own broths. It is HUGE! Way bigger than my largest stove top coil. It is sturdy, so I think I will be making lots of stocks, if the stove top can handle it :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristi H.

customer_reviews.title: Good big pot!
customer_reviews.text: This HUGE pot arrived in perfect condition. Its weight, thickness, and finish are flawless. It has a heavy bottom to aid with heat distribution. It seems to be a very high quality item at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mayhem

customer_reviews.title: Induction bottom separating.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used this pot for a couple of years and now the laminated induction bottom is separating from the bottom of the pot and will fill with water when washed creating a potential safety concern. We will need to replace the pot with a new one. I will not go with an induction ready pot which is not necessary for our use cooking crabs.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska-Island

customer_reviews.title: new kitchen needed new pots. this huge one is great
customer_reviews.text: We have had a chance to use this pot finally and it's just great. Fits on our induction burner on the largest burner and we can just fill it up, get it to boil, and then throw as many corn in there as we want to cook without even thinking twice. We needed a larger pot to make bigger dishes, can't wait to use this as often as possible. Quality is great IMO, look is just like our other new pots/pans, great addition to our new kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Super Pot--and very heavy too,
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a pot. I need a very large pot to cook food for my 80 pound dog, but this pot is so heavy I can hardly lift it empty. We'll see how this works when I cook in it for the first time. It did NOT fit in my typical divided kitchen sink. Fortunately I have another kitchen style sink in the laundry room and it just barely fits in there. I t hink if there were measurements for width and height and weight it would have helped my decision making.
customer_reviews.author: Doggie Mom

customer_reviews.title: seems legit
customer_reviews.text: i use it for test batches of beer and brining meats. has held up well so far. seems sturdy and is easy to clean. i was surprised by the heavy duty feel of this pot. can boil wort, brine meats, cook chili. i have no complaints...atleast not yet; if something goes awry i will update review.
customer_reviews.author: muddy

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy duty, beautiful, and will likely outlast my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.text: Super heavy duty, beautiful, and will likely outlast my grandchildren. It's bigger than I expected, but that's totally fine -- it takes almost a half bushel of apples for applesauce. Suggest that you measure your storage location carefully. Also, keep in mind that it is not easy to lift and move around once it's loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Contrary Mary

customer_reviews.title: COOKING AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT! Ever since I got this, I've been making all kinds of soup and stock in it. I cook food for a living so I need broth all the time. It's heavy so it's stable on the stove. Cleaning is easy too. Just don't let it sit with the water drying off of it. Wipe it down right away to prevent water spots, especially if you don't have water softener in your water system.
customer_reviews.author: pumpkin spice

customer_reviews.title: Great 10 gallon kettle for homebrewing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice kettle for the money. I bought this for homebrewing 5 gallon full batches. My old pot was only 32 quarts and it was taller and narrower. This one will hold 8 more quarts, and it is short and wide so it will fit under my range hood easily. The kettle bottom is layered so heat distribution will be better. I drilled holes near the bottom for a thermometer as well as a ball valve using a step bit, and they sealed perfectly. I would definitely recommend this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Brent P.

customer_reviews.title: Probably one of the best stock pots i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something that's got a thick bottom to prevent scorching, this is your guy. Love this pot. We use it for soups and stews without a problem. It works well on both glass top and induction ranges (we have both) and i'm sure the thick bottom would be fine for gas cook tops as well. Well worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Led Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Induction compatible. Easy to clean because no rivets.
customer_reviews.text: Induction compatible. Easy to clean because no rivets. Huge! I dented it in the sink the first time I tried to clean it. I would recommend scooping water into it with a cup on the counter instead of using the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Holds the heat in and quic
customer_reviews.text: This 20 Qt Stainless kettle is fantastic it really holds the heat well. I use it for boiling my wort for brewing homemade beer. I’m sure it has many other uses like a great big sauce pot for your awesome spaghetti sauce. Final thought, I really like this well made kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stock pot out of frustration with the cheaper brands. I needed a stock pot that would not start boiling the content as soon as I,turned the heat on. The thick base on this pot absorbs heat well and distributes heat evenly on the bottom. The material used is extremely sturdy and easy to clean. My initial concern was that the handles were riveted on rather than welded but that concern was quickly dispelled because the.handles are sturdy even though riveted. I highly recommend this product for those that cook large quantities of soup or canning process you will mót tind a better product fór,the money.
customer_reviews.author: G Man

customer_reviews.title: Nice SS Pot!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a big 'ol pot to warm and mix oils, used in making handmade soaps. This thing hit the mark! Its clad base really adds weight to it, and the pot is not some thin piece of junk!! Well worth the extra bones over the beer-can-thin pots that are twenty bucks cheaper (those also have the negative reviews to back up their cheap prices). Great 5-gallon SS pot!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Stubblefield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home brewing
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for home brewing. Terrific durability, easy to clean - I especially like the bottom (cuts down on in-pot burns) and rivet-less (on the inside) handles to keep the germs away. Highly recommend, nice pot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hazeltine

customer_reviews.title: It's a good pot. Very nice and sturdy - time will ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good pot. Very nice and sturdy - time will tell how the handles on the pot will fair as they are spot riveted on and not held in place with mechanical rivets. Other than that it is a very sturdy heavy pot with a nice heavy bottom. Perfect for making beer in.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but this item is one of the few things to impress me enough to do so. It's very heavy and sturdy, seems to have good heat distribution, and is reasonably priced. There was a metallic smell to mine, but it didn't seem to impart any flavor to water, which I boiled, cooled and drank as a test.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to experiment with beer making. It's a great size and super easy to clean, even with sticky sugars. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brown

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my pot! It’s very impressive in appearance and weight. It’s solid. I can’t wait to use it! I’ll update my review once I do on clean ability and heat distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first stock pot I've ever purchased, and it is so nice. It's high quality stainless steel and just a great addition to my kitchen. We made a big pot of bone broth and I was able to freeze several portions to have later. Very happy with the quality and value of this cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have just used this to make a massive batch of marinara sauce, which was awesome. It has a nice heavy bottom so things won't burn as easily as on cheap pots. Huge capacity and sturdy handles, lid fights snugly Two cons with this product. First, the label does not remove cleanly and leaves some glue residue which will never come off. Second, its too big to fit in my cabinets, which I should have thought about checking. Oh well, still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pot when making crab legs, soup or “family size” spaghetti sauce for a large family. Pot is sturdy and and well made. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine R Staszak

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed pot. It is heavy, items will not scorch. Do NOT buy the light weight stainless pots, they will not provide the cooking characteristics you want from a pan. Really pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I really like it
customer_reviews.text: This pot is built sturdy and has worked well on two separate brew days, and I expect it to serve me well on the third one coming up soon.
customer_reviews.author: José J. Amador

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size stock pot
customer_reviews.text: Finally I can get an entire turkey carcass in the pot to make soup or make an entire batch of Frogmore stew. I should have bought this along time ago. Great for making batches of soup stock, too.
customer_reviews.author: Postlgrl

customer_reviews.title: Great pot and fantastic value.
customer_reviews.text: Great pot and fantastic value. I've made a couple batches of gumbo with this on an induction stove top and am very happy with the performance. Nice even heating.
customer_reviews.author: Travis McGee

customer_reviews.title: I love them but I never cook with them
customer_reviews.text: I use these for water filtration, but when I got these I considered ordering another one to use for cooking. They came packed really nicely and they certainly were well made I had quite a bit of trouble drilling through the bottom of them...
customer_reviews.author: jeremy koehler

customer_reviews.title: Great pot for making cheese!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a five gallon pot for making large batches of cheese, and this pot is now my kitchen work horse. I bring the milk up to temp, an then I use it to strain the curds. The quality is unbeatable for the price!! I will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2cookinWI

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I went cheap the first time and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I went cheap the first time and was totally disappointed. I have a glass top range and while doing 5 quarts of soup this pot is getting a good boil at 3 (10 being the highest) and a little lower. My large frying pan glass lid fits this pot. Bottom line, love it. If you need a 20* quart stock pot this should be seriously considered. *I have read it is a couple cups less than 20 but don't know for sure. It's more than I'll need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and is aboutt 3/5 of an inch ...
customer_reviews.text: Use to make soups for potluck type dinners and get togethers. Everyone asks where we got as it is much larger than anything you would get in a standard cookware set. Easy to clean and is aboutt 3/5 of an inch narrower than our other pot of similar size and sits perfectly inside for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Random guy on the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Great stock pot for canning
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty stock pot! So far I have made boiled cider (cooked off 4 gallons of apple cider to a little more than half-gallon), cooked 35 apple pie fillings for freezing, and made almost a 4 gallon batch of tomato salsa. The stock pot has performed just as I'd hoped. The insulated base, while heavy, does not allow scorching/burning if you do a minimum of stirring. The perfect addition to my kitchen. May get another for the really big harvests, waiting for apple butter...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It is sturdy and well made. It cooks evenly. I love stainly steel. It is just as easy to clean up as that supposed non-stick stuff that flacks all through your food. That junk is terrible and bad for the health of the family. Get good stainles steel that holds up for a lifetime and produces better tasting and healthier foods. This size is great for large stews, soups, and even spagetti sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Mia-Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pot!
customer_reviews.text: Distribution of heat is good the pot is heavy duty. I use it to make big pots of soup for church events!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size Works for Home Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I cook for my dog (a huge commitment!) and make two 20 qt stockpots of pureed chicken stew at a time. I used to use two 12 qt pots but wanted to do bigger batches to stretch out the time between. This is about as big as I can go with pots for a home kitchen. They just fit on the stove positioned on the burners kiddie corner. And just fit in the double compartment kitchen sink. The induction feature gets them hot in no time and they are easy to clean. They will give my dog, Gabby, many years of homemade chicken dinners! I am a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! It's huge! I can make up big batches of stews, soups, pastas etc...and freeze the batches. It's especially nice for when we are feeding large groups of students or friends/family. I'm so glad I bought this pot! It's great!
customer_reviews.author: KVH

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great 20qt pot for the price and quality!! Heavy duty and perfect for making large soups
customer_reviews.author: R Gold

customer_reviews.title: SUPER-GREAT OATMEAL, RICE, PASTA POT
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a vast array of really bad cooking pots over the years qualifies me to say that this is as close to a perfect porridge pot as one may ever find. It is a great weight, has a perfectly fitting lid, that is easy to toss on, non-heat-transferring handles, dishwasher safe, convenient size. After having this for three years now, I am impressed that it has not warped one iota. (Still sits perfectly flat on counter.) Five stars and happy mama in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: HAPPYMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Great mid to large stock pot for home
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for soups or making smaller batches of stock. For veggie stock, go with a much larger pot.
customer_reviews.author: always curious

customer_reviews.title: You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and beautiful. Like that food doesn't stick to bottom. Heats up evenly. Only thing is its smaller than expected but that's my fault. A perfect "in betweener" pot. Not too big, not too small. I highly recommend this pot.
customer_reviews.author: catherinemarie

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value for money
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value for money, huge stock pot perfect for bone broth and stock! Would have been 5/5 but mine arrived with a smallish dent, not worth the trouble to return and works great anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jamaliya Cobine

customer_reviews.title: I used this baby as part of my maple syrup ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this baby as part of my maple syrup making activities this past Winter. This pot made it easier to finish the syrup on my portable induction oven, thereby saving energy..
customer_reviews.author: L. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Surprising good quality
customer_reviews.text: Solid, heavy, no inside rivets, and it distributes heat well. It’s huge!
customer_reviews.author: JBUICE

customer_reviews.title: Will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest pot I own. Bought if for canning because I have a glass stove top & enamel pans are not recommended. Wish I had this years ago. It will last a lifetime. Nice & sturdy. Has some weight to it. Cooks nice & even, no scorching of tomatoes that I had in it. Easy to clean. Used it several times & looks like new still.
customer_reviews.author: TreeLady

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, thick bottom
customer_reviews.text: Nice thick bottom. My wife made her amazing potato soup and her chili and she loved that she didn't have to worry about stuff burning to the bottom every time she turned her back for a moment.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wexell

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!!
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been cooking my Gumbo in an inferior pot. I have a glass cook top and the bottom of the pot was uneven. Making roux was very difficult, until now! Making the roux was a breeze, and for once, I had no problems of veggies getting burned on the bottom of the pot. The even heat was amazing. I would highly recommend this big, durable pot!!
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: POT
customer_reviews.text: GET YOUR CRAB, LOBSTER, SHRIMP OR GUMBO AND START COOKING WITH THIS BAD BOY.
customer_reviews.author: Cari D Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pot...the rim has a bit of a sharp feel to it so you must not let the rim hit your hand..they could have rounded it off more. It cooks evenly. I clean it and dry it good after use to prevent spots. Cooking large amount of anything is no problem with it...fits nicely on top of out gas stove.
customer_reviews.author: D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy I went with this pot. I got the 20QT pot. I read a bunch of other pot reviews for other pots and found that most were incredibly flimsy. Got my pot today and it is extremely sturdy and looks high quality. Glad I didn’t go cheap. I’m going to use this for brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Stock Pot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a stock pot I could make double portions of the Natural Traditions chicken broth in. This one fills the bill. I can place two chickens plus lots of veges in it and still have room to spare. It's sturdy, I love the lid and the handle, and it cleans beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, large soup pot.
customer_reviews.text: A great soup pot-I had to get rid of my expensive teflon soup pot...it burned thicker soups even on low heat. This pot distributes the heat from an electric oven top nicely and I've yet to burn anything since I bought it. I'm glad I purchased the more expensive and larger pot-It will easily take a whole chicken if you like to make chicken vegetable soup with lots of ingredients this is ideal. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: PlantCrone

customer_reviews.title: Commercial Grade 16 qt. Pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot with the triple layered base worked perfectly when making spaghetti sauce. It virtually eliminated the need for constant stirring when cooking with a stainless steel pot. The heat distribution was exceptional. I would recommend this pot for any gourmet person who expects their dishes to turn out perfectly. I have already recommended this product to my Brothers and my children. Actually, if I see other sizes made with the same quality as this one, I will purchase it. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Induction stove ready pot
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use on induction stove (works well on induction). While not up to higher-end products like All-Clad products this pot is well made, sturdy and comes with a nice matching top. This is an excellent buy for the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eyecarehawaii

customer_reviews.title: Solid stock pot. Quality construction and accurately described. ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid stock pot. Quality construction and accurately described. Delivery was briefly delayed but worth the wait. Well packaged and protected. It was double boxed. Works great with the Thunder Group 40qt steamer basket.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: The rim of the pot has 2 1/2" cracks in it and it looks like the beginnings of a couple more
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these in different sizes at the same time. Of the 3, this is the only one with issues. They are used for canning and are kept in a non climate controlled building. They were used last year. This year is when the problem was noticed. The rim of the pot has 2 1/2" cracks in it and it looks like the beginnings of a couple more. Many good reviews (that is why I bought them) but just and FYI and be aware.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! I was looking for a stockpot with a heavy bottom for cooking down large amounts of tomato & applesauce. In the past I have used a stockpot that was fairly lightweight & it had a tendency to scorch on the bottom which ruins the sauce. So far this pot has been amazing, I even made catsup in it & it worked beautifully. You really can't beat the price for such quality.
customer_reviews.author: James U.

customer_reviews.title: A great stainless steel pot
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend loves this stock pot that I bought for her. She makes large batches of vegetable soup in it and running it on medium heat (as the instruction that come with it recommend and) with its multiply bottom it does not burn on the bottom of these pot. And it cleans up very nicely with just soaking.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny B.

customer_reviews.title: 24 qt fits a canning rack
customer_reviews.text: For those looking like I was, the 24 quart does fit a standard metal rack for canning jars. The 20 quart does NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylon M.

customer_reviews.title: Great stock pot!
customer_reviews.text: Used for maple syrup reduction. Works great, heavy and holds heat well!
customer_reviews.author: M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new go to pot for cooking. I was using a shallower pot for cooking pasta but this one is so much better. It is deep and there are no water spills on my stove! The directions said not to use salt as it stains the interior but if you boil the water first and then add the salt there is no problem. I am crazy about this beautiful pot, so happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: J M J

customer_reviews.title: Great for big batches of sauce
customer_reviews.text: We canned 12 pints and 3 quarts of spaghetti sauce, and it all cooked in this giant pot with plenty of room to stir and then some
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect brew kettle for my small batches
customer_reviews.text: Perfect brew kettle for my small batches. It is definitely stainless, gave me a hell of a time drilling it out
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Nogy

customer_reviews.title: great induction-ready pot
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for canning and pickling. It works great on an induction cooktop.
customer_reviews.author: zeozod

customer_reviews.title: I Shoulda listened!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to what the reviewers were saying. It came dented. As expected. Returned it for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This pot is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! I use it to make cheese. So far, the biggest batch I have made is a 3 pound pepper jack. The pot is heavy, so while it takes a bit to get the heat started, it heats evenly and stays warm (which is perfect for my needs). Some cheese require the temp to maintain 100 degrees for an extended period of time (90 minutes). One down side, which does not at all detract from the 5 star rating, is that this pot is heavy. So be careful when moving it when it is full.
customer_reviews.author: BoB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pot for a couple of years now. Very heavy and durable stainless...more like professional grade but it will last a lifetime and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: It easily holds 20 quarts
customer_reviews.text: I've used the pan for different things including risotto for several people. The bottom is heavy so foods don't burn and the pan, in general, is quite solid. I did check the capacity. It easily holds 20 quarts. I've mostly used it with gas (including an outdoor burner). Only negative - my box had obviously been opened before and taped shut and the pan has a small dent in it.
customer_reviews.author: JRinn

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty pot!
customer_reviews.text: Love this beautiful pot! Perfect for my soup making. I only wish I were taller! Haha! It'd make stirring much easier. And, oh yes, a bigger sink in which to wash the pot. Neither, of course, is the fault of the pot! Seriously though, I'm very happy with this purchase and its price.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Piccardo

customer_reviews.title: Good item but received with a dent.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is my fourth one, using in restaurant on induction burners. Would be five stars but I dropped one star for the most recent one showing up with a dent. Not a product lack, but shipping fail.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: Great induction pot.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 8-quart pot expressly for induction cooking and am very happy with it for this purpose. I bought a 16-quart Update International stock pot a few years ago, so choosing this brand was an easy decision. Both are very high quality, restaurant-grade cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N. Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: ... is phenomenal and the quality of the metal is great. I've used to make large batches of Pho ...
customer_reviews.text: The size is phenomenal and the quality of the metal is great. I've used to make large batches of Pho (Vietnamese Beef Noodle soup)!
customer_reviews.author: Lagrange

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for over the camp fire cooking. Works great very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Stock Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these pots for a chili cookoff. This pots is pretty thick, works on my induction cooktop, and two of them just barely fit side by side on a Camp Chef Everest stove. The bottom is pretty thick and did really well for me for simmering the chili over long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Yoli

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I ordered it based on all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous 8-quart pan, I love it! I ordered it based on all the positive reviews and they were all right. I make a lot of home made soups and this pot is big enough and sturdy enough. It also fits in my sink for washing. The 3-ply base is similar to my complete set of 3-ply stainless steel pans I purchased in 1974 and still use them every day. They look great and are wonderful to cook in! I ordered the 12-quart pan first but it was WAY too big for what I needed so I returned it and got the 8-quart. Wonderful and durable pan but never use chlorine bleach on stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: business reader

customer_reviews.title: best stock pot
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 3 weeks now on an induction cook top. Best stock pot i've owned in a while. price was on point and evenly heat distribution. Looks like it will last forever
customer_reviews.author: Mei

product_meta.title: Update International w Induction Ready Stock Pot with Cover, 100-Quart, Silver
product_meta.description:
Size:100-QuartSPS-100 Size: 20. 13" H x 20. 5" W x 20. 5" D Features: -Material: JYH21CT. -Rive handle. Color: -Satin. Material: -Stainless steel. Dimensions: -Thickness: 0. 04-0. 05"/19-20 Gage. Size 10. 5" H x 13. 88" W x 13. 88" D - Overall Width - Side to Side: -13. 88". Size 10. 5" H x 13. 88" W x 13. 88" D - Overall Height - Front to Back: -10. 5". Size 10. 5" H x 13. 88" W x 13. 88" D - Overall Depth - Top to Bottom: -13. 88". Size 12" H x 15" W x 15" D - Overall Depth - Top to Bottom: -15".

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Stock pots are a staple of any professional kitchen. Their large size allow it to be a versatile vessel for making soups stews chilies broths stocks or pastas. Update International's 100-qt. induction ready stainless steel stock pot with cover (SPS-100) is excellent for making a large batch of your restaurant's signature soups. This NSF-Listed SuperSteelÂ® stock pot features a 3-ply bottom consisting of two layers of stainless steel surrounding a 5mm aluminum core. This results in superior strength and heat distribution and allows the pan to be used on induction ranges.
feature_bullets: Can be used with induction cookers
